chemoreception.notes: Sensory capabilities are poorly studied in this family. Chemoreception is likely used for host detection, as with many parasitic flatworms, but this is not explicitly stated in the provided data.

mechanoreception.notes: Mechanoreception may be used for orientation and attachment to hosts. Without more information, it is hard to assess the function of the sense.

photoreception.notes: The presence of photoreceptors in Rugogastridae is unknown. Given the parasitic lifestyle, it is likely absent, but data is required.
